org.jtrim.property

Interface PropertySourceProxy<ValueType>

  • Type Parameters:
    ValueType - the type of the value of the PropertySource
    All Superinterfaces:
    PropertySource<ValueType>

    public interface PropertySourceProxy<ValueType>
extends PropertySource<ValueType>
    Defines a PropertySource which is backed by another PropertySource. The backing PropertySource can be replaced by a call to the replaceSource method. The value of the PropertySourceProxy always depends on the actual backing PropertySource.

    The implementation takes care of properly registering listeners with the backing PropertySource and notify listeners registered with the PropertySourceProxy.

    Warning: Adding a listener to the PropertySourceProxy may retain a reference to the listener even if the listener is automatically unregistered by the backing PropertySource. Therefore you cannot rely on automatic unregistering. The only exception from this rule is when the backing PropertySource unregisters the listeners immediately. In this latter case, implementations of PropertySourceProxy are required to detect this and not to retain references to the listener.

    Thread safety

    The replaceSource method of this interface are not required to be thread-safe. That is, it must not be called concurrently with other method calls of this interface unless they are defined to be thread-safe. Other methods derived from PropertySource retain their thread-safety property.

    Recommendation: When using the property for Swing components, it is recommended to only call the replaceSource from the AWT Event Dispatch Thread because this is consitent with other property usages in Swing.

    Synchronization transparency

    The replaceSource method of this interface is not required to be synchronization transparent.
    See Also:
    PropertyFactory.proxySource(PropertySource)

      void replaceSource(PropertySource<? extends ValueType> newSource)
      Changes the backing PropertySource to the newly specified one.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.jtrim.property.PropertySource

        addChangeListener, getValue

    • Method Detail

      • replaceSource

        void replaceSource(PropertySource<? extends ValueType> newSource)
        Changes the backing PropertySource to the newly specified one. That is, getting the value of this PropertySourceProxy will return the actual value of the newly set backing PropertySource after this method returns.

        Subsequent changes to the previous backing PropertySource will not affect this PropertySourceProxy after this method returns.

        Note: This method causes the property change listeners to be notified and in most implementation this causes the listeners to be called synchronously in this method.

        Parameters:
        newSource - the new backing PropertySource. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified PropertySource is null
